column4: could someone help me remove a package?  I'm getting this error: http://pastebin.com/d241f7d48
I kind of just let it alone, but now I can't install a new package without first removing that
what about other 2.6.27-14-generic files in /boot. Are there any?
ok, you can edit /var/lib/dpkg/status and remove the paragraph talking about 2.6.27-14-generic. Make a copy of the file *first*. THat should make dpkg forget all about it....
I think you'll need to reinstall grub2, and maybe a kernel, via the live-cd
i'm chrooted into my root partition
well what does it say to do next?
hey I rebuilt my initrd.img and sort of my grub folder, but how do I make vmlinux and system.map?
I thought they come when you install a kernel?
I would think that too but they're not there :/
dpkg -S /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.31-16-generic-pae on my system says it came from package linux-image-2.6.31-16-generic-pae
woo I just completely removed the kernel and rebuilt it, now I have to fix things in the grub folder... says there's no stage1
could you use dpkg on your system to see what package /boot/grub/stage1 is in?
I can't, I have grub2, it doesn't use stage files. Someone else will have to oblige you or you can maybe web search it....
I just installed grub2, it looked like it worked.. well cya later! thanks
